results.title: Your children's teeth
results.creator_credit: Jane Massy, Margaret Thomson, C O I and Realist Films
results.brief_description: The structure of the teeth, tooth formation and the process of decay are explained by means of diagrams. The importance of pre-natal care and of proper diet, cleaning habits and regular inspections are also shown

results.title: Your children's sleep
results.creator_credit: Jane Massy, Brian Smith and Realist Films
results.brief_description: The theme of this film is why children can’t sleep, what sleep does for children, and why it is much more important for them than it is for adults. Insignificant to the adult, the problems of childhood are real and frightening to children. Because sleep is for children a vital continuation of waking life, during which their minds have a tremendous amount of sorting out to do, some of their problems may cause restlessness and nightmares. Parents can help their children to get sound, healthy sleep by giving them a sense of security and well-being.

results.title: Your career: insurance
results.brief_description: Deals with the careers available to young men and women in the field of fire, accident and marine insurance. From correspondence sorting and office work, men can advance to executive positions, insurance inspectors, surveyors, and assessors. Women have the opportunity of careers as typists, punch card accounting machine operators and secretaries. Includes interesting shots of Melbourne and office procedures and equipment of the period (pre 1970s feminism).

results.title: Your amazing mind
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Opens with a lengthy discussion of the importance of human brain power in the progress of civilisation. Proceeds to discuss the different types of drugs available and the dangers of using them without prescription. Explains various types of drugs and discusses the effects of each on the human brain.
